Name: Sculptors model with two sides
Description: The plaque is worked on two sides. The recto contains three registers: the first and the second each represent a ram, the third is decorated with two kings heads, wearing the nemes. On the verso, at the left, there is a ram. The accompanying text informs us that this could be a representation of the god Khnum-Re, Lord of the cataract. On the right, one notices the main part of a sistrum and a short vertical inscription mentioning the goddess Hathor, Mistress of Dendera.
